stem: A client on Sertraline (SSRI) for depression was recently prescribed Linezolid. He presents with a temperature of 101.8Â°F, agitation, shivering, and hyperreflexia (+4 patellar reflexes). Complete the bowtie to guide management.

actions.text: Increase the dose of Sertraline to stabilize mood

rationale.correct: Two serotonergic agents (SSRI + Linezolid) = Serotonin Syndrome. Signs: Hyperreflexia, Agitation, Autonomic instability. Priority is stopping meds and using Benzos to control tremors/BP. Vitals and Reflexes are the primary monitoring points.
rationale.incorrect: Dantrolene is for Malignant Hyperthermia/NMS. Increasing the SSRI dose would be fatal. While CK can rise in any syndrome with muscle activity, it is not the primary monitoring parameter for serotonin syndrome stability unlike reflexes (clonus).
clinicalPearls: The presence of 'ocular clonus' (slow rhythmic eye movements) is highly suggestive of Serotonin Syndrome.

Priority is stopping meds and using Benzos to control tremors/BP. Vitals and Reflexes are the primary monitoring points. The presence of 'ocular clonus' (slow rhythmic eye movements) is highly suggestive of Serotonin Syndrome.

reviewUnits.heading: Testing Trap â€” Mixing NMS and Serotonin Syndrome
Priority Interventions for Serotonin Syndrome
reviewUnits.body: The priority nursing interventions are: Discontinue all serotonergic medications immediately; Administer IV Benzodiazepines (Diazepam). Monitor: Vital signs (BP/HR/Temp); Deep Tendon Reflexes and Clonus. Dantrolene is for Malignant Hyperthermia/NMS. Increasing the SSRI dose would be fatal. While CK can rise in any syndrome with muscle activity, it is not the primary monitoring parameter for serotonin syndrome stability unlike reflexes (clonus).
